3 PACKAGE = 'amr_mapping'

5 import sys

9 from exceptions import Exception
10 from amr_mapping.map_store_py import MapStore, MapStoreCone

12 import random
13 
14 class SonarMap:
15  """
16  Ported from C++ by Ivan Vishiakou
17  Original description still applies:
18 
19  This class implements the sonar map algorithm as described in "Sonar-Based
20  Real-World Mapping and Navigation" by Alberto Elfes, IEEE Journal Of
21  Robotics And Automation, Vol. RA-3, No. 3, June 1987.
22 
23  Map coordinates vs. map cells
24 
25  The map works internaly on a discrete, integer-based grid, but exposes a
26  more natural continuous coordinates interface. This allows an application
27  to work with the map using its own units (in this documentation refered to
28  as "meters"), without taking care of details of the map storage
29  implementation.
30 
31  Each cell with integer coordinates (c_x, c_y) occupies the space from
32  ((c_x - 0.5, c_y - 0.5) * resolution) exclusive to
33  ((c_x - 0.5, c_y + 0.5) * resolution) inclusive.
34 
35  The value resolution is the length of a cells edge. All cells are considered
36  to be squares.
37 
38  Note: if a variable name starts with the prefix "m_", then this variable
39  contains a map coordinate. If the name starts with "c_" then this variable
40  contains a cell coordinate. This convention applies both to the functions'
41  arguments and internal/local variables.
42  """
43 
44 
45  def __init__(self, resolution, m_size_x, m_size_y):
46  """
47  This constructor creates a map of given dimensions.
48 
49  Args:
50  resolution (float) : size of a cell, measured in meters, i.e. the length of
51  the edge of a cell.
52  m_size_x (float) : initial size of the map in x direction (meters).
53  m_size_y (float) : initial size of the map in y direction (meters).
54  """
55  self._resolution = resolution
56  self._c_size_x = int(round(m_size_x/resolution+2))|1
57  self._c_size_y = int(round(m_size_y/resolution+2))|1
58  self._m_size_x = resolution * self._c_size_x
59  self._m_size_y = resolution * self._c_size_y
60  self._m_min_x = -self._m_size_x/2.0
61  self._m_min_y = -self._m_size_y/2.0
62 
63  self._map_combined = MapStore(self._c_size_x, self._c_size_y)
64  self._map_free = MapStore(self._c_size_x, self._c_size_y)
65  self._map_occupied = MapStore(self._c_size_x, self._c_size_y)
66 
67 
68  def add_scan(self, m_sonar_x, m_sonar_y, sonar_theta, field_of_view,
69  max_range, registered_range, uncertainty):
70  """
71  Update map using a sonar reading.
72 
73  Args:
74  m_sonar_x (float) : x coordinate of the sonar in map coordinates.
75  m_sonar_y (float) : y coordinate of the sonar in map coordinates.
76  sonar_theta (float) : orientation of the sonar in map coordinates.
77  fov (float) : opening angle of the sonar (radians).
78  max_range (float) : maximum possible range of the sonar (meters).
79  distance (float) : range reading returned from the sensor (meters).
80  uncertainty (float) : the noise associated with the sensed distance,
81  expressed as the standard deviation.
82  """
83 
84 
85  #============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
86  """
87  Instructions: implement the routine that performs map update based on a
88  single sonar reading.
89 
90  Hint: use convertToCell() and convertToMap() functions to convert between
91  map and cell coordinates.
92 
93  Hint: use MapStoreCone class to iterate over the cells covered
94  by the sonar cone.
95 
96  Hint: you may use helper functions provided to you (euclidian_distance,
97  angular_distance, clamp)
98 
99  Some snippets for your convenience.
100  MapStoreCone creating:
101 
102  cone = MapStoreCone(c_sonar_pos_x, c_sonar_pos_y, sonar_theta,
103  field_of_view, c_cone_length)
104  the last argument is cone length in cells (since all the linear sizes it operates
105  are in terms of cells!)
106 
107  Iterating over cone cells:
108  for cell in cone:
109  #Do stuff
110  # cell is a tuple (c_x, c_y)
111  pass
112 
113  Reading/Setting cells of the map (MapStore):
114 
115  occ_val = self._map_occupied.get(*cell) # cell = (c_x, c_y)
116  occ_val = self._map_occupied.get(c_x, c_y) #
117 
118  self._map_occupied.set(c_x, c_y, new_occ_val) # setting map cell value
119 
120  Hint: see the _convert_to_map(cell) function description. It can be used
121  to check whether a cell is in bounds of the map. (You do not need to set/read
122  cells that lie beyond the map grid)
123 
124  Alternatively you can use
125  self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(c_x) # returns boolean
126  self._map_combined.is_in_y_range(c_y) # returns boolean
127 
128  //============================================================================
129  """
130  sigma = uncertainty
131  R = registered_range
132  omega = field_of_view
133  m_sonar = (m_sonar_x, m_sonar_y)
134  S = self._convert_to_cell(m_sonar)
135  cells = []
136  occ_vals = []
137  emp_vals = []
138  if (S!= None):
139  cone = MapStoreCone(S[0], S[1], sonar_theta,
140  omega, int(round(R/self._resolution)))
141  delta = 0.0
142  occ_sum = 0.0
143  for cell in cone:
144  P = self._convert_to_map(cell)
145  if (P != None):
146  cells.append(cell)
147  p_e = 0.0
148  p_o = 0.0
149  emp_init = self._map_free.get(int(cell[0]), int(cell[1]))
150  occ_init = self._map_occupied.get(int(cell[0]), int(cell[1]))
151  com_init = self._map_combined.get(int(cell[0]), int(cell[1]))
152  delta = self.euclidian_distance(m_sonar_x, m_sonar_y, P[0], P[1])
153  angle_sp = math.acos(self.euclidian_distance(m_sonar_x, m_sonar_y, P[0], m_sonar_y)/delta)
154  theta = self.angular_distance(angle_sp, sonar_theta)
155  if (delta >= R - sigma) and (delta <= R + sigma) and (abs(theta) < omega/2.0):
156  p_o = self._er_occ(R, delta, sigma) * self._ea(omega, theta)
157  occ_kc = p_o * (1 - emp_init)
158  occ_vals.append(occ_kc)
159 
160  # =================== SUMMING OVER ALL THE CELLS =============================
161  for cell in cone:
162  P = self._convert_to_map(cell)
163  if (P != None):
164  cells.append(cell)
165  p_e = 0.0
166  p_o = 0.0
167  emp_init = self._map_free.get(int(cell[0]), int(cell[1]))
168  occ_init = self._map_occupied.get(int(cell[0]), int(cell[1]))
169  com_init = self._map_combined.get(int(cell[0]), int(cell[1]))
170  delta = self.euclidian_distance(m_sonar_x, m_sonar_y, P[0], P[1])
171  angle_sp = math.acos(self.euclidian_distance(m_sonar_x, m_sonar_y, P[0], m_sonar_y)/delta)
172  theta = self.angular_distance(angle_sp, sonar_theta)
173  #Computing Probablility for free space
174  if (delta < R - sigma) and (abs(theta) < (omega/2.0)):
175  p_e = self._er_free(R, delta, sigma) * self._ea(omega, theta)
176  emp_init = (emp_init + p_e) - (emp_init * p_e)
177  emp_vals.append(emp_init)
178  self._map_free.set(int(round(cell[0])), int(round(cell[1])), emp_init)
179  #Computing Probablility for occupied space
180  if (delta >= R - sigma) and (delta <= R + sigma) and (abs(theta) < omega/2.0):
181  p_o = self._er_occ(R, delta, sigma) * self._ea(omega, theta)
182  occ_kc = p_o * (1 - emp_init)
183  occ_sum = np.sum(occ_vals)
184  if occ_sum != 0.0 and (R < max_range - 0.35):
185  occ_kn = occ_kc / occ_sum
186  occ_kn = self.clamp(occ_kn, 0.0, 1.0)
187  occ_init = (occ_init + occ_kn) - (occ_init * occ_kn)
188  self._map_occupied.set(int(round(cell[0])), int(round(cell[1])), occ_init)
189  if (occ_init >= emp_init):
190  self._map_combined.set(int(round(cell[0])), int(round(cell[1])), occ_init)
191  elif (occ_init < emp_init):
192  self._map_combined.set(int(round(cell[0])), int(round(cell[1])), -emp_init)
193 
194  def _er_free(self, sensed_distance, delta, uncertainty):
195  """
196  Calculate free-space probability.
197 
198  This function calculates the probability to be free for a point that is
199  delta meters away from the sonar's origin when the sonar has measured a
200  distance of sensed_distance with given uncertainty. This function only
201  computes the radial component of the probability. To fully specify
202  a point you need a distance and an angle and as such for the full
203  probability you need the angular probability of the point to be the cause
204  of the measured sensed_distance. This is calculated by _ea().
205  The full probability is the product of the result from _ea() and from this
206  function.
207 
208  Args:
209  sensed_distance (float) : distance in meters measured by the sonar.
210  delta (float) : distance from the sonar's origin for which the probability
211  should be calculated.
212  uncertainty (float) : uncertainty (variance) of measured distance.
213  Returns:
214  float : The probability to be free for a point delta meters away from
215  the sonar's origin. The value is in the range 0.0 to 1.0.
216  """
217 
218  #============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
219  #Instructions: compute the distance probability function for the "probably
220  # empty" region.
221  R = sensed_distance
222  sigma = uncertainty
223 
224  if delta < R - sigma:
225  return 1 - ((delta/(R - sigma))**2)
226  elif (delta >= (R - sigma)) and (delta <= (R + sigma)):
227  return 1 - (((delta - R)/sigma)**2)
228  else:
229  return 0.0
230 
231  def _er_occ(self, sensed_distance, delta, uncertainty):
232  """
233  Calculate occupied-space probability.
234 
235  This function calculates the probability to be occupied for a point that
236  is delta meters away from the sonar's origin when the sonar has
237  measured a distance of sensed_distance with an uncertainty of
238  uncertainty. This function only computes the radial component of
239  the probability. To fully specify a point you need a distance and an angle
240  and as such for the full probability you need the angular probability of
241  the point to be the cause of the measured sensed_distance.
242  This is calculated by _ea(). The full probability is the product of the
243  result from _ea() and from this function.
244 
245  Args:
246  sensed_distance (float) : distance in meters measured by the sonar.
247  delta (float) : distance from the sonar's origin for which the probability
248  should be calculated.
249  uncertainty (float) : uncertainty (variance) of measured distance.
250 
251  Returns:
252  float : The probability to be occupied for a point delta meters away
253  from the sonar's origin. The value is in the range 0.0 to 1.0.
254  """
255 
256  #============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
257  #Instructions: compute the distance probability function for the "probably
258  # occupied" region.
259  R = sensed_distance
260  sigma = uncertainty
261 
262  if delta < R - sigma:
263  return 1 - (delta/(R - sigma))**2
264  elif (delta >= (R - sigma)) and (delta <= (R + sigma)):
265  return (1 - ((delta - R)/sigma)**2)
266  else:
267  return 0.0
268 
269  def _ea(self, sonar_fov, theta):
270  """
271  Probability for a point in the sonar cone to be actually measured.
272 
273  This function calculates the probability of a point theta radians away
274  from the center beam of a sonar cone of sonar_fov angular width, to be
275  the cause of a sonar measurement.
276 
277  Args:
278  sonar_fov (float) : the opening angle of the sonar cone in radians.
279  theta (float) : the angular distance of a point from the center of the
280  sonar cone, measured in radians. This value must lie within plus/minus
281  sonar_fov / 2.
282 
283  Returns:
284  float : Probability of a point in the sonar cone to be measured,
285  value in range 0.0 to 1.0 as a funciton of angular distance to the
286  central line of the sonar cone.
287  """
288 
289  #============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
290  #Instructions: compute the angular probability function (it is same for both
291  # the "probably empty" and the "probably occupied" region.
292  if abs(theta) <= sonar_fov/2.0:
293  return 1 - (((2*theta)/sonar_fov))**2
294  else:
295  return 0.0
296 
297  def _convert_to_map(self, c_pos):
298  """
299  Converts cell coordinates to metric coordinates. Examples:
300  m_pos = convert_to_map(c_pos) #c_pos = (c_x, c_y)
301 
302  returns tuple (m_x, m_y) or None if cell coordinates out of bounds
303  """
304  c_x, c_y = c_pos
305  if ( self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(c_x) and
306  self._map_combined.is_in_y_range(c_y) ):
307  return (c_x*self._resolution, c_y*self._resolution)
308  else:
309  return None
310 
311  def _convert_to_cell(self, m_pos):
312  """
313  Converts metric coordinates cell coordinates. Examples:
314  c_pos = convert_to_map(m_pos) #m_pos = (m_x, m_y)
315 
316  returns tuple (c_x, c_y) or None if cell coordinates out of bounds
317  """
318  m_x, m_y = m_pos
319  c_x, c_y = int(round(m_x / self._resolution)), int(round(m_y / self._resolution))
320  if ( self._map_combined.is_in_x_range(c_x) and
321  self._map_combined.is_in_y_range(c_y) ):
322  return (c_x, c_y)
323  else:
324  return None

342  return self._map_combined.get_publish_data(-1.0, 1.0)
343

345  return self._map_free.get_publish_data(0.0, 1.0)

348  return self._map_occupied.get_publish_data(0.0, 1.0)
349 
350  @staticmethod
351  def euclidian_distance(*args):
352  """ Returns euclidian distance between two points:
353  dist = euclidian_distance(pos1, pos2)
354  dist = euclidian_distance(x1, y1, x2, y2)
355  """
356  try:
357  if len(args) == 2:
358  #tuples
359  return math.sqrt((args[0][0]-args[1][0])**2+(args[0][1]-args[1][1])**2)
360  elif len(args) == 4:
361  #x's and y's:
362  return math.sqrt((args[0]-args[2])**2+(args[1]-args[3])**2)
363  else:
364  raise Exception('Invalid arguments for euclidian_distance()')
365  except Exception as e:
366  print "Exception caught:", e.message
367 
368  @staticmethod
369  def angular_distance(a1, a2):
370  """Returns angular distance between two angles"""
371  return math.atan2(math.sin(a1-a2), math.cos(a1-a2))
372 
373  @staticmethod
374  def clamp(value, min_val, max_val):
375  """Helper function to clamp a variable to a given range."""
376  return max(min(value, max_val), min_val)
